intro: Kadua romanzoffiensis, commonly known as the Romanzoff's kadua, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, arranged in dense, disc-like clusters, and bloom during the dry season. Kadua romanzoffiensis is adapted to the arid and semi-arid conditions of its native habitat, with a deep root system to access groundwater.
